alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 7:34AM MST until January 02 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Visibility lowering to under a half mile at times. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph in wind prone areas. Gusts to 40 mph in the Laramie Valley, including Laramie. * WHERE...Wind prone areas of southeast Wyoming to include Arlington...the Interstate 80 Summit and eastern foothills. * WHEN...Through 11 PM tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
